questions.question_text: Which of the following encrypts the traffic on a leased line?

A router has learned three possible routes that could be used to reach a destination network. One route is from EIGRP and has a composite metric of 20514560.
Another route is from OSPF with a metric of 782. The last is from RIPv2 and has a metric of 4. Which route or routes will the router install in the routing table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
AD for EIGRP is lower than OSPF and RIP

Selected Answer: E
the route with low administrative Distance is more preferable.
EIGRP = 90
Ospf = 110
RIP = 120

The route with low administrative Distance is more preferable.
EIGRP = 90
Ospf = 110
RIP = 120

choices.C: switch-1 will forward the data to its default gateway
choices.D: switch-1 will send an ARP request out all its ports except the port from which the data originated
choices.B: switch-1 will flood the data out all of its port from which the data originated
choices.A: switch-1 will drop the data because it does not have an entry for that MAC address

discussion.content: Going by the wording "switch-1 will flood the data out all of its port from which the data originated" - B is not correct. The word except is missing in B to make it the correct answer. Maybe it's a typo
Other sites have B listed as "B. Switch-1 will flood the data out all of its ports except the port from which the data originated." which makes much better sense as the correct answer.

discussion.content: A network engineer wants to allow a temporary entry for a remote user with a specific username and password so that the user can access the entire network over the internet. Which ACL can be used?
Please, reorganize the correct answer, D
